data.name: Print chains
data.description:
Given an array of 2 lettered strings.

Some elements of the array can be chained to others if first letter of an element equals to the last letter of other element.

Your task is to build an array of objects. Each object - is a key: value pair. Key is one of initial array's elements, and value is an array of all possible chains starting with that element as a value.

Ex:
-----------------
const data = ["AB", "BC", "BS"];
...
>> [{ AB: ["ABBC", "ABBS"]}]

PS: keys in resulting array should respect initial array's elements order.
PS1: Chains in each of resulting array's element's value should respect initial array's elements order.

PUZZLE: Sometimes your code will halt on timeout. Guess why? Fix!
